comments.en:
Multi-function device: Printing, scanning, copying.

To get all functionality of this printer working under Linux, especially also the non-printing features, like scanning, printer status, maintenance, and photo download from memory cards, use the HPLIP driver package from HP.

The best printout quality you will get with the HPLIP driver, provided by HP (compatible to the HP DeskJet 990C), especially the 1200-dpi high resolution mode gives excellent photo quality (the rendered bitmap is 1200x1200 dpi, but the printer hardware does an interpolation then and prints with the printer's highest resolution). Also the Gimp-Print driver is reported to work (Model setting: "pcl-900").

When used with HP's HPLIP driver, this printer auto-detects the ink cartridge type and does appropriate dithering and colour adjustment internally, controlled by the hardware. Note that in contrary to most other newer HP inkjets the paper type has to be adjusted on the front panel, there is no paper type sensor. So when Ghostscript with the HPLIP driver only renders the image with 300 or 600 dpi, higher resolutions are used for the internal dithering. There is also a special high resolution mode where the image is rendered in 1200 dpi and interpolated to 4800x1200 dpi by the hardware, intended for photo paper.

Border-less (full bleed) printing on paper sizes up to Oufuku-Hagaki is supported with the HPLIP driver.

Consumables/Refills: One Color(CMY) + one Black(K) or Photo (cmK)
